physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a woman in a bathing suit
 sitting on a beach towel
 on sand. Her legs are outstretched and she is facing downwards. She is photographed in mid-action
 with her hands towards the left of the photograph. Behind her
 there are several items seen
 including a bag
 several magazines
 and shoes

sgcool_label_text:This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of Corporal A. Silver at the beach
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a woman in a bathing suit, sitting on a beach towel, on sand. Her legs are outstretched and she is facing downwards. She is photographed in mid-action, with her hands towards the left of the photograph. Behind her, there are several items seen, including a bag, several magazines, and shoes
metadata.subject_terms_2: Photographs Portrait photography Women Beaches Recreation
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
